intro: Gypsophila perfoliata var. araratica, commonly known as sweet pea flower or Arctic gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, lace-like foliage and clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often used in garden settings for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate. This variety is particularly suited to cooler climates and can be grown in containers or as a border plant.
